page.title: 14Changing Longworth (Village)
page.content: The milkman had to push his cart up and down the rough country roads and paths.The milkman had to start his job very early or he would not finish it in time. One of the jobs on the farm was to plough the fields by guiding the big shire horses up and down. People did not have much money during the war so they were not able to have as many things as we do now.Some women went to work on the land so they could earn some money and look after their children.Also there was a shortage of food so people had ration books that they could take to the local shop and get food from there. There used to be a big hospital just outside the village and many people worked there. It is sold now.
